          class Fenw:
              def __init__(self, size):
                  self.n = size
                  self.tree = [-10**18] * (self.n+1)   # 1-indexed, size+1

              def update(self, idx, val):
                  i = idx+1
                  while i <= self.n:
                      if val > self.tree[i]:
                          self.tree[i] = val
                      i += i & -i

              def query(self, idx):   # query prefix [0, idx] (0-indexed)
                  if idx < 0:
                      return -10**18
                  i = idx+1
                  res = -10**18
                  while i:
                      if self.tree[i] > res:
                          res = self.tree[i]
                      i -= i & -i
                  return res

      We'll create a class:

          class Fenw:
              def __init__(self, size):
                  self.n = size
                  self.tree = [-10**18] * (self.n+1)   # 1-indexed, so we use 1..n

              def update(self, index, value):
                  # index: 0-indexed in our array, so we convert to 1-indexed: pos = index+1
                  i = index+1
                  while i <= self.n:
                      if value > self.tree[i]:
                          self.tree[i] = value
                      i += i & -i

              def query(self, index):
                  # query the prefix [0, index] (0-indexed) -> so we want [1, index+1] in 1-indexed.
                  # if index < 0, return -10**18
                  if index < 0:
                      return -10**18
                  i = index+1
                  res = -10**18
                  while i>0:
                      if self.tree[i] > res:
                          res = self.tree[i]
                      i -= i & -i
                  return res

              self._da = [-INF] * (n * 5)
              self._op = [-INF] * (n * 5)

                  return
